title: Usmanned Aerial Vehicle For Airborne Reconnaissance, System For Usmanned Defense And Method Using The Same
abstract: Disclosed Is An Unmanned Aerial Vehicle For Aerial Reconnaissance, Which Performs Object Detection And Object Hit Based On Image Information, And An Unmanned Defense System And Method Using The Same. The Unmanned Aerial Vehicle For Aerial Reconnaissance Comprises: An Image Information Collecting Unit For Collecting Image Information Of A Predetermined Area; And A Control Unit For Detecting An Object Existing In The Predetermined Area Based On The Collected Image Information. Accordingly, Accurate Information On A Current Status Of Friendly And Enemy Forces Is Collected And Transmitted By Performing Continuous Reconnaissance And Surveillance Using An Unmanned Aerial Vehicle To Perform Object Detection And Identification Of The Friendly Forces And Enemy Forces. In Addition, Various Operations Are Able To Be Carried Out In Case Of War By Hitting An Object Assumed To Be The Enemy Forces, Thereby Significantly Reducing Damage Of The Friendly Forces.Copyright Kipo 2017

title: Storage Device For Live Ammunition
abstract: The Present Invention Relates To A Device To Store Ammunition, Storing Ammunition In An Ammunition Feeding Trailer To Store (Load/Recover) The Ammunition In A Fighter, To Prevent Vacancy Of The Stored Ammunition. According To The Present Invention, The Device Comprises: A Conveyor Element Including A Plurality Of Carriers In Which The Ammunition Is Received; A Separation/Mounting Unit Separating The Ammunition Of The Fed Link Ammunition From A Link Member To Mount The Ammunition On The Carrier; A Link Ammunition Feeding Tray Connected To The Separation/Mounting Unit And Feeding The Link Ammunition To The Separation/Mounting Unit While Being Inclined By A Predetermined Angle; An Ammunition Feeding Tray Disposed In An Upper Part Of The Conveyor Element To Feed The Ammunition One By One; An Ammunition Detection Unit Disposed In The Conveyor Element, Detecting Whether Or Not The Ammunition Is Mounted On The Carrier, And Stopping Operation Of The Conveyor Element When The Ammunition Is Not Detected; A Cap Separation Plate Disposed On One Side Of The Conveyor Element And Separating A Warhead Protection Cap Of A Tracer Disposed By A Predetermined Number Of Fed Ammunition; And An Ammunition Storage Unit Installed On An End Side Of The Conveyor Element And Storing The Fed Ammunition In The Ammunition Feeding Trailer.Copyright Kipo 2018
applicant: TESS CO LTD; KOREA AEROSPACE INDUSTRIES LTD

title: In-Flight Impact Angle Determination Apparatus For Biased Proportional Navigation Guidance,  Method Thereof,  And Computer Readable Storage Having The Same Method
abstract: The Present Invention Relates To A Flight Vehicle Navigation Technique And,  More Specifically,  Relates To An In-Flight Target Impact Angle Determination Apparatus For Biased Proportional Navigation Guidance And A Method Thereof. According To The Present Invention,  An In-Flight Target Impact Angle Generated By Relative Geometry Changed In Launching Time And Hitting Time.(Aa) Start(Bb) End(S310) Set Engagement Situation(S320) Perform Batch Simulation(S330) Induction Error Calculation(S340) Extract Target Collision Angle Set With Induction Error(S350) Calculate The Difference Between The Target Collision Angle And The Reference Target Collision Angle And Define The Same As The Target Collision Angle Correction Valuecopyright Kipo 2018

title: No Catching Stelles Metal Goods From Electric Wave.
abstract: The Present Invention Relates To Stealth Metal Capable Of Avoiding Radio Detection. By Forming Irregularities On The Outside Of Friendly Fighters, Missiles, Ships, Submarines, Torpedoes, Tanks And So Forth, Radio Waves Emitted From Enemy Radars Can Be Dispersed In Irregular And Various Directions Rather Than Being Reflected Toward The Insertion Angle Or The Radio Waves. Therefore, The Stealth Metal Prevents The Location Of The Friendly Fighters, Missiles And Ships From Being Detected By Enemy Forces.Copyright Kipo 2015

title: The Method Of Calculating Missile-Masking Area And The Operational Method Using That
abstract: The Present Invention Relates To A Method For Calculating A Missile Masking Area,  Comprising The Steps Of :  Loading A Model Of The Fuselage Of A Fighter Aircraft;  Extracting The Position Of An Armed Seeker Applied To The Fuselage And Setting The Same As A Reference Position;  Calculating A Masking Area Which Is A Visual Field Blocking Area By The Fuselage,  At The Reference Position;  Storing Information On The Masking Area. According To The Method For Calculating A Missile Masking,  The Problem Of Visual Field Blocking Of A Missile Seeker Which Can Occur During An Actual Weapon Operation Stage Can Be Determined In Advance By Calculating The Masking Area Using Non-Real-Time Simulation Modeling,  And Data For Selecting Another Missile Is Provided If There Is A Problem. Therefore,  It Is Possible To Have An Advantage In An Urgent Air-To-Air Combat.Copyright Kipo 2018

title: Unmanned Defense System
abstract: An Unmanned Defense System Is Disclosed. The System Comprises An Unmanned Reconnaissance Aircraft,  An Unmanned Control Device,  And An Unmanned Cannon. The Unmanned Reconnaissance Aircraft Transmits Image Information Of An Enemy Position To The Unmanned Control Device. The Unmanned Control Device Analyzing The Image Information Finds Out A Firepower Concentrated Position And A Shelling Direction Of The Enemy,  Controls The Unmanned Cannon To Shell The Firepower Concentrated Position Of The Enemy,  And Generates Position Information Of A Safety Zone In Accordance With The Shelling Direction Of The Enemy.

abstract: Field :  Weapons And Ammunition.Substance :  Invention Relates To Military And Special Equipment,  And Namely To Robotic Systems Intended For Remote Operation Under Combat Conditions;  Figure 8 Shows A Throttle Cable Actuation Pattern. A Combat Robot Module Includes Equipment Attachment Devices That Are Made In The Form Of A Plate Arranged On A Frame Of A Self-Propelled Transport Vehicle. The First Framed Post Is Installed On The Frame,  Inside Which There Fixed On A Transition Plate Installed On Shock Absorbers Is A Generator Driven From An Internal Combustion Engine,  Which Are Connected To Each Other With A Belt Gearing And A Belt Tension Control Mechanism. title: Suicide Bomber Blast Threat Mitigation System
abstract: A Non-Lethal, Sabot-Deployed Blast Shield Mitigates A Suicide Bomber By Wrapping Around The Bomber And Positioning A Plurality Of Protective Layers Over An Explosive Device To Absorb Emitted Heat, Shock Waves, And Projectiles If The Device Is Detonated. Stand-Offs Such As Inflatable Beams Or Pillows Provide Break-Away Zones Between The Protective Layers, Allowing Some Layers To Expand To A Point Of Failure And Absorb The Maximum Possible Energy. Inner Layers Absorb Shock Waves And Heat. One Or More Outer Layers Resist Projectile Penetration. Protective Layers Can Be Positioned On Opposing Sides Of A Suspect In Case Two Explosive Devices Are Present. Shields Can Deploy With Sufficient Energy To Knock Down A Bomber. In Embodiments, A Plurality Of Shields Can Be Applied Without Interference Therebetween. In Some Embodiments, A Round Shield Includes Bolas Which Spread The Shield In Flight In A Cast-Net Dynamic And Wrap Around The Suspect For Shield Attachment.

title: Power Source Unit Body For Catapulting, And Aircraft Carrier Gas-Steam Catapult And Catapulting Method
abstract: A Power Source Unit Body For Catapulting. The Power Source Unit Body For Catapulting (77) Comprises A High-Pressure Chamber (7), A Flow Splitting Chamber (8) And A Cooling Water Chamber (9). High-Temperature High-Pressure Fuel Gas Generated Through Burning Of Gunpowder (36) Enters The Flow Splitting Chamber, A Part Of The Fuel Gas Enters A Vertical Pipe (29) From A Fuel Gas Inlet, And Another Part Of The Fuel Gas Squeezes A Water Bag (19) In The Cooling Water Chamber, So That Cooling Water In The Water Bag Is Sprayed Into The Vertical Pipe From A Cooling Water Nozzle, And Is Mixed With High-Temperature High-Pressure Fuel Gas To Generate Steam, And The Steam And The Gunpowder Fuel Gas Are Formed Into Mixed Gas. In The Power Source Unit Body For Catapulting, Gunpowder Is Placed In A Cartridge Case (6), And When It Is Required To Release Energy, By Means Of Percussion, The Power Source Unit Body For Catapulting Releases High-Pressure Gas, Thereby Implementing Catapulting Of A Shipboard Aircraft. Also, An Aircraft Carrier Gas-Steam Catapult And A Catapulting Method For Implementing Catapulting Of A Shipboard Aircraft By Use Of The Power Source Unit Body For Catapulting.
